job_desc: Join our team as an IT Data Engineer Specialist and play a critical role in designing, optimizing, and maintaining our data transformation and warehousing processes. If you’re passionate about data, performance, and collaboration, this role is for you.; Key Responsibilities:; Design, develop, and maintain data transformation processes to cleanse, transform, and aggregate data within the data warehouse.; Optimize and streamline data workflows to ensure efficient processing and storage.; Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement the right data transformations.; Develop and maintain database schemas, tables, and views to support reporting and analytics needs.; Implement data governance policies to ensure data quality, security, and compliance.; Monitor and maintain system performance, troubleshoot issues, and optimize scalability and efficiency in the data warehouse and data pipelines.; Qualifications:; Minimum 3 years of experience in data engineering or a related field.; Strong understanding of data transformation and warehousing concepts and have skill about Python, Bash Linux, SQL Server, PostgresSQL, Docker, Apache Airflow; Familiarity with data governance and security best practices.; Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

We are looking for Data Engineer to be part of our IT Business Insight and Analytics Team.; Job Description:; Mining data from primary and secondary sources, then reorganizing said data in a format that can be used by next process such as data analytics, data science or any AI/ML processes; Manage day-to-day operation in collecting, storing, processing and analyzing huge sets of data including construct data storages and data-access tools (data lake approach); Monitor overal performance and stability of the system, warehouse cleansing and ensure track pipeline stability; Job Requirements:; Have at least 7-12 years of experience in data lake implementation; Experience on design & setup data lake architecture, topology, and infrastructure; Experience with ETL and ELT data pipeline hands-on & implementation; Proficient with data lake related skills, such as : Cloudera, Dataiku, Object Storage, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Airflow,Dremio, Python, R, Docker, Kubernetes, Iceberg/HUDI, etc; Good & have passion on data processing; Working location: Serpong

Job Description:; To analyze and validate data source readiness and integrity; To build and organize a data pipeline (ETL/ELT) procedure for usage in a data warehouse environment; Routine work of monitoring and troubleshooting data processing performance; To identify potential problems and create solutions for more robust and efficient data processing; To assess and implement new cloud technology and big data platforms; Requirements :; A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or relevant disciplines from a top university; Minimum 1 year of working experience as a Data Engineer or ETL Developer; Strong analytical skills & high sense of logical thinking; Experience developing data warehouse schemas with OWB, ODI, or other enterprise ETL technologies; Have expertise and experience with a cloud solution, preferably a GCP Platform.; Willing to work onsite & fulltime in Bintaro, Tangerang Selatan

Role: Expression of Interest - Sr. Pipeline Engineer (Contract Based)
job_desc: About the job; We’re looking for a Senior Pipeline Engineer (Contract Based) to join our Indonesia team.; When you work for us, you get the chance to join nearly 50,000 people all driven by a common purpose of delivering a more sustainable world. We’re excited about the challenges ahead. We believe there’s never been a more rewarding time to work in the energy, chemical and resources sectors.; As Senior Pipeline Engineer, you will be responsible for the pipeline system facilities.; To succeed in this role, you should have minimum ten (10) years’ experience in Oil & Gas industry and minimum seven (7) years’ experience in engineering design of Pipeline systems including mechanical design, PLETS, installation, and pre-commissioning.; Who we are; Worley is a global professional services company of energy, chemicals and resources experts headquartered in Australia.; Right now, we’re bridging two worlds as we accelerate to more sustainable energy sources, while helping our customers provide the energy, chemicals and resources that society needs now.; We partner with our customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their portfolio of assets. We solve complex problems by finding integrated data-centric solutions from the first stages of consulting and engineering to installation and commissioning, to the last stages of decommissioning and remediation. Join us and help drive innovation and sustainability in our projects.; What you’ll do; We are looking for Senior Pipeline Engineer to join our team in Jakarta, Indonesia.; The role responsibilities include:; Responsible for the pipeline system facilities, by developing the design concepts, design criteria and specifications, performing analysis, calculations and reviewing and implementing government regulations as well as industrial codes and practices in order to satisfy COMPANY requirements.; What you’ll have; Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering related field, and ideally be professionally registered or chartered as an engineer with a recognized engineering body.; Minimum ten (10) years’ experience in Oil & Gas industry.; Minimum seven (7) years’ experience in engineering design of Pipeline systems including mechanical design, PLETS, installation, and pre-commissioning.; Experience relating to coordination of offshore installation activities in deepwater and shallow water inclusive of shore pull-in and commissioning activities.; A thorough knowledge of the relevant Industry codes and standards is required.; Demonstrate capability in Pre-FEED, FEED and/or EPCI by listing up the experienced project names and Project Phases of Pre-FEED, FEED and EPCI.; Moving forward together; We want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. So, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection and innovation.; We’re building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace. Creating a space where everyone feels they belong, can be themselves, and are heard.; And we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. We're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology.; Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.; Ready to join us? Apply now to submit your CV

Responsibilities :; Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture; Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.; Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.;  Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and On-prem/ Cloud technologies.; Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics; Qualifications :; 2-4 years of experience as a data engineer.; Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.; ETL tools knowledge is required.; Experience building and optimizing big data pipelines, architectures and data sets.; Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.;  Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.; Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.; A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.

Job Description; Core Banking Migration: Participating in the migration of core banking systems.; Reconciliation of Core Banking Migration Results: Ensuring the accuracy and consistency of data after core banking migrations.; ETL DWH Migration: Assisting with the migration of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes for the Data Warehouse.; Regulator Report: Contributing to the generation of reports required by regulators.; Transaction Reconciliation: Performing reconciliation of transactions.; Code Analysis and Workflow Design: Being able to analyze problems and read code, as well as designing workflows using flowcharts.; ETL Tools and Database Understanding: Mastering ETL tools and demonstrating a strong understanding of databases.; Programming: Applying knowledge of one or more programming languages.; Job Qualifications; Education: Minimum D3 (Diploma Three), preferably S1 (Bachelor's degree), or equivalent from any major with experience in the IT field.; Work Experience: Minimum 1 - 5 years of experience in the relevant field.; General Knowledge: Understanding of general banking flow.; Ability to analyze problems and read code.; Ability to design workflows using flowcharts.; Technical Skills (Skillset): Databases and Data Management: Proficiency in SQL, Data Warehouse concepts, MySQL/Postgres/MS SQL, Oracle, DB2, and Big Data technologies.; ETL Tools: Mastery of ETL tools such as ODI, IBM DataStage, Talend, or Pentaho.; Programming Languages: Knowledge of one or more programming languages, with PHP specifically mentioned.; Other Technologies: Familiarity with SOA, ISO 8583, SOAP Web Service, and API.

Business Function; DBSI T&O is the backbone that supports the bank as the central of operations and technology. With the spirit of OneTeam and PRIDE! Value, we serve Institutional Banking Operations and Consumer Banking Operations, manage Customer Centre and IT, provide Group Procurement and Corporate Real Estate, coordinate bank-wide Business Continuity Management program and framework, and deliver service quality for Digibank and IBG/GTS. Our Technology & Operations organization is a vital strategic partner to the business in providing competitive advantage that propels DBSI towards being the Best Bank for a Better World (#B3W).; Responsibilities; Collaborate with regional team, business unit, support unit and other related party for any projects.; Ensure user requirements on data needs are captured; Develop scripts/tools to support data requirements and ingestion from BU/SU; Maintain good relationships between IT and business, manage business expectations and negotiate compromise; Requirements; Minimum 4 years of relevant working experience; Understand key data concepts, develop data set processes, techniques and considerations in Machine learning and Data analytics; Training and relevant experience in one or more of the following areas \:; Statistical modelling tools such as\: R, Python, SAS, etc; Data manipulation using scripting languages like Python or using ETL tools; Visual analytics technologies like Tableau, Qlikview, PowerBI, etc; End-to-end analytics architecture, preferably with some working knowledge of big data stack; Passion towards automation where appropriate and beneficial; Unix Shell Scripting and knowledge of Job scheduler; Excellent understanding of technology life cycles and the concepts and practices required to build big data solutions; Ability to understand and build re-usable data assets or features to enable downstream data science models to read and use

Job Description; Design and implement scalable data pipeline using modern data platform (Spark, Flink, Kafka, Airflow); Build and manage ETL/ELT processes to ingest data from various sources (databases, APIs, files, message queues); Develop and maintain data models and data warehouse / datalake architectures; Ensure high data quslity and implement data validation, observability and monitoring frameworks; Collaborate with other team such as data analyst, data scientist and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver data solutions; Optimize performance of big data processing jobs and ensure cost efficiencient data infrastructure; Advocate for best practices in data engineering, including documentation, testing, version control and other with team; Minimum Qualifications; Bachelor degree from Computer Science or Informatic Engineering; Min. 3 years experience as Data Engineer or similar role; Strong proficiency in SQL and programming language (Python, Java or Scala); Hands on with distributed data processing framework (Apache Spark, Kafka, Flink); Solid understanding of data modelling, data warehouse and query performance optimization; Experience with cloud platform such as Alibaba Cloud, AWS, GCP or Azure; Familiarity with modern orchestration tools like Apache AirFlow or other; Experience with CI/CD and DevOps practices in data engineering

About the Role As Sr. Data Engineer for our global Data Enrichment squad, you will be responsible for implementing data flows using Apache Airflow and AWS, incorporating functionalities such as external API’s, AI/ML components, and GenAI. You will work in close collaboration with your ETL Lead and Product Owner to translate the requirements of our customers and stakeholders to ETL data flow features and then build and run them. You improve the operations of the ETL data flows by improving our monitoring capabilities, automated error recovery, and scalability.; Responsibilities:; ● Develop and maintain ETL workflows using Apache Airflow and AWS services.; ● Take ownership of complex ETL tasks and AWS Lambda functions.; ● Design ETL pipelines and review work from junior team members.; ● Contribute to building secure and scalable data solutions.; ● Operate and monitor data flows in production environments, supporting junior colleagues as needed.; ● Improve the resilience, reliability, and performance of ETL systems.; ● Automate recurring operations and optimize performance.; ● Guide junior team members in testing practices and setting up automated tests.; ● Promote and model best practices for documentation across the team.; Requirements:; ● 5+ years of experience as a full-time Data Engineer; ● Hands-on experience delivering projects using Apache Airflow in the past 2 years.; ● Proficiency with AWS; ● Experience with PostgreSQL and/or OpenSearch.; ● Strong SQL skills demonstrated through past roles and projects.; ● Experience implementing and improving CI/CD pipelines for ETL processes.; ● Solid understanding and several years of experience working with Python in a production environment.

Job Description; Bertanggung jawab dalam membangun dan memelihara sistem data-platform, mulai dari tahapan proses pengumpulan data dari berbagai data-source (extract), data-cleansing (data quality) dan data transformasi (transform). Data-Platform sebagai tools memberikan insight kepada pengguna dalam melakukan pengambilan keputusan operasional maupun keputusan strategi.; Mengekstrak, mengubah, dan memuat (ETL) data dari berbagai sumber termasuk basis data, API, dan berkas log; Menerapkan pemeriksaan kualitas data dan sistem pemantauan untuk memastikan keakuratan dan konsistensi data; Mengembangkan dan memelihara model data dan data warehouse; Berkolaborasi dengan business-analyst untuk memahami kebutuhan data mereka dan menerjemahkannya menjadi technical-specification; Menganalisa dan melakukan perubahaan terhadap sistem data-platform untuk perbaikan system-error, pemeliharaan dan pengembangan; Menjaga kualitas sistem yang dihasilkan dengan mempertimbangkan user-friend, user-experience, speed performance dan system reliability; Melakukan test terhadap hasil pengembangan/pemeliharaan; Bertanggung jawab atas pengembangan dan pemeliharaan peranti lunak sesuai dengan objektif perusahaan dan kebutuhan pengguna; Qualification:; Berpengalaman min. 2 tahun bekerja sebagai ETL Developer mengembangkan memelihara dan mengelola RDBMS termasuk pembuatan script, store-procedure dan SQL Query; Membuat dan memelihara data pipeline architecture yang optimal untuk integrasi data menggunakan ETL tools seperti SSIS, Pentaho dan Talend; Build data ingestion workflow for data warehouse/data marts/operational data store7; Pengetahuan dan pengalaman terhadap data-warehouse, data-marts, operational-data-store dan master data management; Pengetahuan dan pengalaman dalam database-design dan membangun database; Pengetahuan dan pengalaman dalam pembuatan SQL script dan tuning SQL yang baik

Job Description; What you'll be doing; Platform Implementation; Deploy, configure, and maintain IBM API Connect components (Manager, Gateway, Developer Portal, Analytics); Register and configure Gateway Services, catalogs, and products; API Lifecycle; Define API Products, Plans, and Subscriptions; Implement and test API security policies (OAuth2, API key, mTLS); Manage API versioning, deprecation, and migration strategies; Security & Access Control; Implement role-based access (RBAC) for APIs and Dev Portal; Monitoring & Analytics; Enable and tune API Analytics for traffic, latency, errors, and usage patterns; Support monetization with accurate usage reporting; Integrate with logging and monitoring tools (e.g., ELK, Prometheus); Monetization Support; Collaborate with DevOps and developers to integrate Stripe for API billing; Automate app approval and plan assignment workflows; Support monetization microservices with management APIs; Documentation & Support; Maintain configuration, deployment, and policy documentation; Provide L3 support for API developers and integrators; Deliver training for consumers and internal teams; Minimum Qualifications; What we're looking for; 2-5 years experience in API Management platforms, with 2+ years in IBM API Connect; IBM certified solution developer - API Connect v10 (Gateway, Manager, Portal, Analytics); Experience with IBM DataPower Gateway configuration and debugging; Experience developing SNAP BI; Experience with Stripe billing integration or API monetization models; Knowledge of financial compliance or regulated environments; Prior experience in HA/multi-cluster environments (OpenShift/K8s a plus); Familiarity with API design principles, protocols, and best practices (e.g., REST APIs, OpenAPI/Swagger 3.0); Experience managing API gateway technologies, developer Portals, and OAuth Integrations; Strong understanding of API versioning, security, and authentication mechanisms; Ability to write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code; Experience with CI/CD tools (GitHub Actions, GitLab, Jenkins); Experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Helm; Experience with OAuth2, JWT, mTLS, LDAP, OIDC; Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills

Job Descriptions:; Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture for report, business intelligence (BI) dashboard.; Create report and business intelligence (BI) dashboard need by organization.; Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery that needed by BI and reporting services; Create the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and big data technologies.; Create analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics.; Create data tools for analytics in building and optimizing reporting services.; Ensure the effectiveness and efficiency of operational database system.; Monitor database & system operational activities in Bina Nusantara.; Maintain data security and accuracy in Bina Nusantara; Provide excellent service towards users, in relation to database authorization, change and withdrawal (web & workgroup); ; Requirements :; Minimum Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field; Had experience 2 years as Data Analyst or related field is a plus; Understanding of structured query language (SQL); Demonstrated experience with BI Tools (Tableau, Power BI, OBIEE, Qlikview).; Experience interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques; Experience presenting findings to business partners across the organization, including executive leadership; Experience with database software/web applications; Strong analytical and organisational skills; Ability to work well in a fast paced environment, where the technology is constantly changing

About the Role; We are seeking a highly skilled Data & Analytics Engineer to drive data-driven decision-making by designing, optimizing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines and analytical solutions. This role involves working with Amazon Athena, MySQL, Google Sheets, and Holistics to manage, analyze, and visualize key business data. You will play a crucial role in building a scalable budget and forecasting tool, integrating transaction data with HubSpot data, and optimizing data workflows to support financial and operational insights.; Key Responsibilities; Data Engineering & Management:; Design and develop SQL-based data pipelines to integrate HubSpot, MySQL transaction data, and Athena.; Develop and optimize queries for Athena (Presto-based SQL) to ensure efficient data retrieval and reporting.; Develop, maintain and enhance data models on dbt to support analytics and reporting needs.; Develop dynamic SQL scripts for extracting and transforming data that support cross functional requirements; Automate data ingestion from various sources, ensuring scalability and maintainability; Data Analytics & Reporting:; Work with Holistics BI to create dashboards and automate reporting using Athena queries.; Ensure data accuracy and consistency by implementing validation and reconciliation processes.; Develop Python scripts for ad-hoc data transformations; Budget & Forecasting Tool Development:; Work on a custom web-based budgeting and forecasting application integrated with Holistics.; Enable input capabilities for budget and forecast data using front-end tools.; Collaborate with stakeholders to define business logic and financial modeling requirements.; Key Skills & Experience Required; Strong expertise in SQL (Athena/Presto, MySQL) for complex queries and performance tuning.; Experience with BI tools (Holistics preferred) for dashboarding and reporting.; Proficiency in Python for data manipulation, automation, and scripting tasks.; Experience with Google Sheets API & Athena integrations.; Ability to translate business requirements into scalable data solutions.; Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.; Nice-to-Have Skills; Experience with cloud-based data lakes (AWS S3, Athena, Glue, etc.).; Familiarity with HubSpot data structures and CRM analytics.; Exposure to web-based data entry tools for budgeting & forecasting solutions..

At Catalyst, People are the heartbeat of our company. We believe that good quality people will have a positive impact on our business. We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our growing team. If you are passionate about being part of the team, building some of the most critical products, and Working alongside teams in the industry across product, engineering, and design, Let’s join us!; ; Job Description:; Develop data models and maintain company metrics and dashboard.; Develop and maintain ETL data pipelines.; Do automate testing to ensure data quality.; Translates complex functional and technical requirements into detailed design and high performing data applications.; Research or explore any new technologies to complement or improve requirements and current technologies.; Collaborate with management, business partners, analysts, developers, architects, and engineers to support data quality efforts.; ; Requirements:; Possess at least 2 years of experience in Data Engineering. Experienced working in e-commerce or marketplace is preferred.; Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, IT, Mathematics or related field.; Strong proficiency in Python, R, and SQL.; Strong data modeling knowledge.; Strong foundation in Data Query/Manipulation.; Have experience managing and designing data pipelines, debugging data issues.; Experienced in DBT (Data Build Tools) and Snowflake.; Experience working with complex ETL and Data warehouse will be a bonus.

About EY: EY, a global leader operating in over 150 countries, delivers exceptional service in Consulting, assisting clients in transforming and enhancing their capabilities. We are dedicated to helping our clients build a better working world, creating long-term value for people and society, and fostering trust in capital markets. This commitment begins with a culture that prioritizes training, opportunities, and creative freedom, empowering you to make impactful changes. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, the exceptional EY experience is designed to last a lifetime. With a focus on hiring and developing passionate individuals, we strive to be the best employer in the industry. At EY, you’ll have the opportunity to build a career as unique as you are, supported by a global network, an inclusive culture, and cutting-edge technology. We value your unique voice and perspective, which will help us improve even further. Join us to create an exceptional experience for yourself and contribute to a better working world for all.; The Opportunity: You will play a crucial role in guiding our clients through their business and technology transformation journeys. We expect you to provide a unique perspective on how technology can enhance and transform their organizations, addressing key business challenges. This area is characterized by high growth and visibility, offering numerous opportunities for skill enhancement and career development.; Your Key Responsibilities: You will collaborate with a diverse range of clients and colleagues to deliver the latest trends, practices, technologies, and architectures. Your focus will be on designing, building, and maintaining scalable and robust solutions that unify, enrich, collaborate, and deliver value.; Requirements:; A minimum bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Management, Information Technology, Information Systems, or Information Engineering.; At least 5 years of experience in data exchange, data integration, or data sharing projects specifically for national identity and digital ID programs.; Proven experience in at least 2 projects involving the design and implementation of data exchange solutions for large-scale national-level projects.; A strong background in consulting services and technical advice related to National Digital Identity and identity verification methods, including biometrics, document verification, and facial recognition.; What We Look For: We seek passionate individuals with a strong vision and a commitment to staying ahead of industry trends. If you have a genuine enthusiasm for helping businesses reach their full potential, this role is for you.; What We Offer:; Continuous Learning: Develop the mindset and skills to navigate future challenges.; Success as Defined by You: We provide the tools and flexibility to make a meaningful impact in your own way.; Transformative Leadership: Gain insights, coaching, and confidence to become the leader the world needs.; Diverse and Inclusive Culture: Be embraced for who you are and empowered to help others find their voice.; If you meet the criteria outlined above, please contact us as soon as possible.; EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, as applicable by law. EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with special needs. If you are a qualified individual with special needs and require assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during the interview process, please speak to our HR executives, and we will be happy to assist you.

Job Descriptions:; You will be responsible for managing data flow, building data pipelines, and ensuring data is available in an optimal format for analysis. We rely on you to build reliable and scalable data solutions. In this role, you must have a strong understanding of data architecture, big data technology, and software engineering practices. Your goal is to help our company manage and utilize data effectively for better decision making.; Job Qualifications:; Bachelor's Degree (S1) in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related fields.; Proven experience as a Data Engineer.; Experience in building and managing data pipelines (ETL/ELT).; Strong understanding of data architecture and big data technology.; Strong skills in SQL and Python.; Experience with big data tools and frameworks (for example, Spark, Hadoop, Kafka).; Experience with data warehouse and data lake (for example, Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake).; Strong problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and collaboration skills.; Key Responsibilities:; Building and maintaining a scalable and reliable data infrastructure.; Develop and manage data pipelines (ETL/ELT) to integrate data from various sources.; Optimize data system performance and ensure data availability.; Build and maintain data warehouse.; Automate data process and increase efficiency.; Monitor and solve problems related to data and data infrastructure.; Maintain clear and detailed documentation of data architecture, data pipeline, and data process.; Preferred Skills:; Expertise in using containerization tools (for example, Docker, Kubernetes).; Advanced knowledge of database security, backup and recovery, and performance monitoring standards.; Experience with implementing CI/CD for data pipeline.

Job Description; Design, build, and maintain robust and scalable data pipelines (ETL/ELT) using modern tools and technologies.; Integrate data from internal and external sources, ensuring data integrity and reliability.; Work closely with data scientists, analysts, and business teams to understand data needs and deliver efficient solutions.; Develop and maintain data models and data warehouses/lakes to support business intelligence and analytics.; Optimize data systems for performance, scalability, and cost efficiency.; Implement data quality checks, monitoring, and alerting systems.; Ensure data privacy, security, and compliance with regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).; Document data pipelines, architecture, and processes clearly and consistently.; Minimum Qualifications; 3+ years of experience in a Data Engineer or similar data-centric role.; Strong experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) for ETL development, deployment, and maintenance.; Proven ability to design, build, and manage ETL pipelines using SSIS.; Hands-on experience with Power BI for building reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.; Solid knowledge of T-SQL and working with SQL Server databases.; Understanding of data quality, data governance, and data lineage concepts.; Familiarity with performance tuning and optimization of ETL processes and SQL queries.

Job Description; Design, develop, and maintain data transformation processes to cleanse, transform, and aggregate data within the data warehouse.; Optimize and streamline data workflows to ensure efficient data processing and storage in the data warehouse.; Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement appropriate data transformations.; Develop and maintain data warehouse schemas, tables, and views to support reporting and analytics needs.; Implement data governance policies and standards to ensure data quality, security, and compliance.; Monitor data warehouse performance, troubleshoot issues, and optimize for scalability and efficiency.; Requirement; Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Informatics Engineering, or a related field with data processing.; 2+ years of professional experience as a Data Engineer or similar role, with a focus on data warehousing, data pipelining, modeling, and transformation.; Proficiency in Python and SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.; Proficiency in Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server, including advanced knowledge of dashboard development, data blending, calculated fields, parameters, and filters.; Experience with application orchestration, Docker and Kubernetes; Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, methodologies, and best practices.; Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform for deploying and managing data pipelines; Experience with cloud data warehouses such as: Google BigQuery and Snowflake.; Understand with data modelling techniques including dimensional modelling, star schema design, and slowly changing dimension (SCD).; Have knowledge of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools to efficiently extract data from various sources, transform it, and load it into the data warehouse.; Familiarity with data quality assurance techniques and tools to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness.; Ability to collaborate effectively with business and technical counterparts to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.; Excellent communication and documentation skills to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.; Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment, managing multiple tasks and priorities effectively

At AIA we’ve started an exciting movement to create a healthier, more sustainable future for everyone.; As pioneering innovators for over 100 years, we’re now transforming our organisation to be faster, simpler and more connected. Because we want to be even better equipped to develop digital solutions and experiences that help more people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.; To get there, we need people with tech/digital/analytics expertise and passion to help develop positive, sustainable change through digitally enhanced experiences that will impact the lives of millions of people and create a healthier future for everyone.; If you believe in developing a better tomorrow, read on. ; About the Role; Responsible to ensure that the business strategy is supported by robust technology system architecture. This role involves identifying and implementing applicable technical standards for projects, as well as analyzing all non-functional requirements, including security, performance, maintainability, scalability, usability, and reliability. This role will ensure that subsequent product engineering adheres to these standards.; Primarily working on Core Data Design, Structure & Definition for all Enterprise Solution; Conducts a system architecture evaluation and collaborates with project management and IT development teams to improve the architecture; Evaluates project constraints to find alternatives, alleviate risks, and perform process re-engineering if required; Analyzes the business impact that certain technical choices may have on a client’s business processes; Supervises and guides development teams; Continuously researches emerging technologies and proposes changes to the existing architecture; Conduct independent research, interpret highly technical documents, draw valid conclusions, develop technological solutions, take appropriate actions and/or make appropriate recommendation related to complex IT problems.; Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.; You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.

Responsibilities:; Developing and managing data pipelines solutions for the organization; Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses; Generate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present findings to stakeholders and support data-driven decision-making;  Requirements:; Strong English communication skills; interviews and meetings will be conducted in English.; Willing to work on-site at the South Jakarta office.; Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.; Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in data engineering.; Solid knowledge of ETL processes, data warehousing, and data engineering best practices.; Proficient in Azure Data Factory, Snowflake, Python, MS SQL, and stored procedures.; Experienced in data migration across various systems and sources.; Skilled in using BI tools, especially Power BI.; Familiarity with SAP CPI, SNPGlue, and BizTalk is a plus.; Proven ability to develop and manage data integration between systems or external parties.;  Why join Us?; We offer very attractive salary and outstanding benefits.; Most of our clients are multinational company which you will be exposed to a large IT environment and valuable experience in international scale projects.; You will always learn new things as our projects always adopt latest technology and best practice available in the market.; Last but not least, we offer a supportive and encouraging environment that puts the emphasis on teamwork. Here, your soft skill (professional relationships, character, attitude) will grow as fast as your technical skill.

What is Shipper:; Shipper is Indonesia's leading digital logistics company, specializing in end-to-end supply chain solutions for e-commerce businesses and enterprises. Established in 2017, Shipper is on a mission to democratize top-tier logistics across Indonesia. We are backed by prominent investors, including Naspers, Floodgate, Y-Combinator, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Insignia Ventures Partners, DST Global Partners, and Sequoia Capital India.; ; About The Role: ; We’re on the lookout for a Data Engineer (or Data Analyst Engineer) to join our growing tech team. You’ll play a key role in building our data pipeline from scratch, ensuring data flows smoothly across systems to support real-time operations and critical business decisions. This isn’t just about ETL — we need someone who can design, build, and scale. If you've ever walked into a company with no data infra and built something others could rely on, we’d love to hear from you.; Tech Stack You’ll Work With:; BigQuery, Google Cloud Storage, AWS S3; Apache Airflow, Database Migration Service (DMS); Databricks, Python; Familiarity with datalake architectures and storage optimization; Optional nice-to-have: Kafka, dbt, PostgreSQL, MongoDB; ; What Will You Do:; Build and maintain scalable data pipelines to support both batch and near real-time needs.; Integrate data from operational systems into our BigQuery warehouse.; Set up workflows and scheduling using Airflow.; Handle database replication and transformation via DMS.; Use Databricks for large-scale data processing.; Manage and optimize data storage layers, including AWS S3, GCS, and datalake environments.; Collaborate with engineers, analysts, and product teams to understand and fulfill data needs; What Are The Requirements:; 5+ years of experience in Data Engineering or similar roles.; Hands-on experience building pipelines from scratch.; Strong grasp of cloud-based data platforms, especially GCP and AWS.; Proficient in Python for automation and transformation tasks.; Able to work independently and provide direction in a fast-moving environment

Job Description; Develop ETL/ELT pipelines using tools like AWS Glue, Airflow, or DBT.; Integrate data from APIs, databases, files, and streams into data lakes or warehouses.; Deliver analytics- ready datasets with strong SQL and schema design (Star/Snowflake).; Maintain data quality using validation tools such as Great Expectations or Collibra.; Optimize infrastructure with Redshift, BigQuery. Athena, and partitioning techniques.; Apply data security and compliance practices (IAM, encryption, masking).; Minimum Qualifications; Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems (Is). Informatics Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.; Minimum 2 to 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer, particularly in building data pipelines and integrations in cloud environments.; Strong understanding of cloud-based data architecture and modern ETL/ELT processes.; Proficient in SQL and familiar with data modeling and schema design.; Excellent problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.; Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and fast-paced environments.

We are SmartCyber, member of Cybertrend, one of the leader data science consultants in Indonesia. We believe as a company that can unlock its full performance capacity and for this purpose we need you to join us.; About the Role; As CLOUD DATA ENGINEER, you will be part of the core team, in ensuring that our product and solution delivered to customers are designed and developed with highly scalable, reliable and maintainable system. As a Cloud Data Engineer, you will responsible for expanding and optimizing data and pipeline architectures, and for enhancing data collection and flow across functional teams.; We are looking someone with:; A bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or similar field is preferred; Knowledge and proven track record experience with Cloud Data Warehouse technologies; Experience in data engineering and cloud data processing services (AWS, GCP or Azure); Experience building, cloud data migration and optimizing cloud big data data pipelines, architectures, and data sets; Good understanding of ETL tools and experience in Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Data Bricks, Snowflake); The work you’ll do:; Work along-side customers to delivery data warehouse migrations leveraging best-in-breed technology tooling; Design and build cloud data driven solutions for enterprise data warehouse and data lakes; Develop scalable and easy to understand data pipelines and data management integration solutions; Research, test and measure different optimization techniques, new technologies (e.g. data streaming) and advanced features of existing technologies (e.g. data warehouse configuration) aimed at speeding up data pipelines; What Cybertrend can offer you:; The unique opportunity to work within data science and artificial intelligence solution for various industries – real world data science, AI , Data Management and Governance experiences; Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, mentorship and coaching, learning development, etc); Attractive compensation and benefits packages; An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams; A clear set of company core values that guide everything we do: GROWTH mindset, SOLUTION oriented, INNOVATIVE achiever, COMPASSIONATE, GOTONG ROYONG and Cool & FUN

- SSIS, SQL Server; - Berpengalaman dengan Inner Join, Left & Right, Cross Join, Delete, Turncate, Drop Table, Execution Plan; - Bahasa pemograman, Framework : C#, .Net, Java; - Bersedia onsite WFO di project CIMB Niaga Bintaro

Summary of The Job; ; The Data Engineer is responsible for building and maintaining scalable data pipelines and platforms to ensure reliable and timely data availability across the organization. This role also manages data ingestion, orchestrates workflows, monitors platform performance and cost, and supports AI/ML engineering through clean, governed, and well-structured data.; ; Responsibilities:; Analyze and organize raw data; Combine raw information from different sources; Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability; Develop and update technical documentation; Technical responsibility for ingesting data and data pipelines to ensure compliance with data standards, architectural standards, and achievement of documented requirements.; Develop and maintain current data ingestion processes and build an analytical layer with a state-of-art architecture.; Innovate new data solutions to achieve business mission.; Manage existing CI/CD process.; Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.; Collaborate with the Engineering team to keep the data integrity between systems.; Requirements:; Previous experience as a data engineer or other position in data field minimum 4 years; Knowledge of programming languages (e.g. Java and Python) with GIT as versioning tools; Hands-on experience with SQL (Oracle, MySQL, Redshift, Hive etc); Familiar with Airflow as workflow management tools; Crave for new technologies with fast learning and understanding process.

Role: Expression of Interest - Lead Pipeline Engineer
job_desc: Company: Worley; :  IDN-JKT-Jakarta City; :  Onshore Pipeline; :  Full-time; :  Jun 18, 2025; :  Jul 18, 2025; :  ; About the job; We’re looking for a Lead Pipeline Engineer to join our team. ; When you work for us, you get the chance to join nearly 50,000 people all driven by a common purpose of delivering a more sustainable world. We’re excited about the challenges ahead. We believe there’s never been a more rewarding time to work in the energy, chemical and resources sectors.; We offer a flexible approach to working, because our people are safer, healthier, and more productive when they can balance work with life. That’s why there are flexible and hybrid working options, so you can choose when, where and how you work.; As a Lead Pipeline Engineer, you will be responsible the pipeline engineering, by developing design concepts, design criteria and specifications, performing analysis, calculations and reviewing and implementing government regulations and industrial codes and practices in order to satisfy the client's SoW and BoD requirements. ; To succeed in this role, you should have experience at least fifteen (15) year experience in the oil and gas industry, at least ten (10) year experience in pipeline engineering discipline and at least five (5) year experience as Lead Pipeline Engineer.; Who we are; Worley is a global professional services company of energy, chemicals and resources experts headquartered in Australia.; Right now, we’re bridging two worlds as we accelerate to more sustainable energy sources, while helping our customers provide the energy, chemicals and resources that society needs now.; We partner with our customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their portfolio of assets. We solve complex problems by finding integrated data-centric solutions from the first stages of consulting and engineering to installation and commissioning, to the last stages of decommissioning and remediation. Join us and help drive innovation and sustainability in our projects.; What you’ll do; We are looking for a Lead Pipeline Engineer to join our team in Indonesia. ; The role responsibilities include:; The pipeline engineering, by developing design concepts, design criteria and specifications, performing analysis, calculations and reviewing and implementing government regulations and industrial codes and practices in order to satisfy the client's SoW and BoD requirements.; Why you should apply; 1. Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical Engineering; Civil Engineering or equivalent, an advanced degree in engineering. Ideally have chartered engineer status within a recognized related Engineering Institution.; 2. At least fifteen (15) year experience in the oil and gas industry, at least ten (10) year experience in pipeline engineering discipline and at least five (5) year experience as Lead Pipeline Engineer.; 3. Has experience in defining pipeline route for large diameter and in deep sea water across the seabed trough and escarpment in a highly active seismic area.; 4. Has led the buckling assessment both lateral and upheaval buckling susceptibility along the pipeline route and recommend mitigation requirements as required. The buckling assessment experience shall include the vessel and material requirements for buckling mitigation and protection in the deep water and when crossing the escarpment where the soil is very soft, steep angle, and involving multiple free span; 5. Has led or managed the freespan analysis and on-bottom roughness assessment to determine whether any pre-intervention or rectification works may be necessary prior to or after pipelay.; 6. Has performed the shore approach design both by trench method and trenchless method (i.e. HDD) and pipeline shore pull design.; 7. Has led the finite element modelling for advance analysis of the free span determination, on-bottom roughness, pipelaying including inline structures, HDD operation simulations, and on-bottom stability; 8. Has experiences on CO2 pipeline design in FEED or detail design.; 9. Extensive experience in FEED and EPCI projects activities related to welding engineering of big bore and deep water pipeline. Proficient knowledge and working experience of welding engineering involved with all phases of projects from FEED to detail engineering and through to construction and pre-commissioning, project management and QC controls and procedures relating to project delivery; Moving forward together; We want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. So, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection and innovation.; We’re building a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace. Creating a space where everyone feels they belong, can be themselves, and are heard.; And we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. We're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology.; Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. Join us to broaden your horizons, explore diverse opportunities, and be part of delivering sustainable change.; Ready to join us? Apply now to submit your CV

About Meridia; Meridia is an AgTech company specialised in field data within complex smallholder-heavy agri-commodity supply chains such as cocoa, coffee, palm oil, rubber and soy.; Meridia Verify®, its flagship SaaS product, verifies supply chain field data in real time – and validates compliance with frameworks such as the EUDR (EU Deforestation Regulation). With Verify, companies can reduce commercial and reputational risk, minimise supply chain disruption and accelerate evidence-based decision-making for strategic sourcing, procurement and trade.; Meridia’s mission is to improve the veracity of datasets driving decision making in global agri-commodity supply chains. Its purpose is to build transparent and inclusive supply chains that afford smallholders a level playing field.; See https://www.meridia.land for more information on our work.; Job Description; As a Lead Data Engineer, you will serve as a senior technical expert responsible for architecting, implementing, and optimizing complex data engineering solutions while mentoring more  junior data engineers. You will lead the development of scalable data pipelines and infrastructure that power Meridia's SaaS products, ensuring high-quality data processing for global, multinational business customers.; You will be based in Indonesia and will work closely with our teams in The Netherlands, as well as with colleagues across Indonesia. You will report to the Data Manager in Indonesia.; Responsibilities; The Lead Data Engineer has the following areas of work and responsibilities: ; Technical Leadership; Lead the design and implementation of robust, scalable ETL pipelines for geospatial data processing using technologies like Airflow, AWS, Google Cloud, and relational databases, and guide Data Engineering team on adoption and maintenance; Architect data infrastructure solutions and data models for metadata to standardize large-scale geospatial datasets from multiple academic, government, and commercial sources into a consistent centralized data lake; Accountable for driving technical decision-making for data engineering tools, frameworks, and best practices across the Data team while considering cost, resourcing, and effort for ongoing maintenance; Ensure adherence to software engineering best practices and ProdEng Principles by Data Engineering team including code review, testing, documentation, version control, and repository management; Team Leadership; Mentor and guide junior data engineers, providing technical guidance, ensuring the ProdEng principles are being followed and career development support; Lead code reviews and ensure high standards of code quality, organization, and reproducibility; Foster knowledge sharing within the team through technical presentations and documentation; Collaborate with the Data Manager on resource allocation and project planning; Act as a technical liaison between the data engineering team and other departments; Core Data Engineering Skills; Expertise in building, optimizing, and maintaining scalable ETL/data pipelines, especially for large and complex geospatial datasets, using modern orchestration and workflow tools such as Apache Airflow.; Proficient in cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud Platform), with hands-on experience architecting data storage, transformation, and metadata solutions in a secure and cost-effective manner.; Strong SQL and data modeling skills, with experience designing relational and NoSQL databases to support data integrity, interoperability, and analytics use cases.; Skilled in Python and relevant data engineering frameworks (e.g., Pandas, PySpark, DBT) for automating data ingestion, cleaning, standardization, and geospatial transformation.; Solid understanding of data governance and best practices in version control (e.g., Git), documentation, data quality assurance, reproducibility, and collaboration in cross-functional data teams.; Domain knowledge and research; Develop domain knowledge of relevant land cover datasets and guide GIS team on dataset creation using software and scripting tools; Contribute to our (internal) data catalogues, manuals, dictionaries, glossary and broader set of terminology in a coherent way across countries, products and projects.; Identify new opportunities for improvement, solve bottlenecks and tackle efficiency issues; Learning and Development; The ideal candidate should be eager and willing to learn and grow in the role. You will be engaged in on-the-job training and development to learn about the land rights sector and our data systems and workflows. You will be mentored by our Data & Methodology team in Indonesia and senior colleagues in Lithuania and the Netherlands.; Requirements; The ideal candidate has/is:; 8+ years of experience in data and 5+ experience building data pipelines ; Deep curiosity for solving real-world problems in agriculture, sustainability, and supply chain transparency, with a mission-driven mindset aligned with Meridia’s purpose.; Strong analytical thinker with a strategic approach to designing efficient, scalable, and maintainable data solutions in resource-constrained environments.; Excellent communicator and collaborator who can explain technical data concepts effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders across cultures and disciplines.; Agile and adaptable, able to quickly learn new technologies, frameworks, and evolving compliance requirements in a fast-paced SaaS environment.; Integrity and accountability, consistently ensuring data privacy, security, and compliance with relevant legal and industry frameworks (such as EUDR).; Proactive, accountable, and a reliable team player; Full working proficiency in English; The following are an advantage:; Familiarity with European Union Deforestation-free Regulation (EUDR) forestry and deforestation definitions; Demonstrated projects or case studies involving forest monitoring or land-use analysis; Start-up or scale up experience.; Benefits; The benefits package includes:; Market rate salary commensurate with your skills and competencies; Four-day work week; A remote working position; Being part of a fast-growing impact venture with an informal, professional work culture; A laptop and an external monitor for your work; Annual employee led Learning & Development budget; Being part of a fast-growing impact venture with an informal, professional work culture; Engaging with team members, clients and users in various other countries; The ideal starting date is August 2025. ; Please note that only applications submitted through Workable will be reviewed.; If you have any questions, feel free to reach out

We are seeking a talented Big Data Engineer with expertise in Python, Big Data Environment, and PostgreSQL/ClickHouse to join our team. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining data pipelines, processing systems, and data warehousing solutions that power our analytics and business intelligence applications.; Qualifications:; 1+ years of experience in software development, with a focus on data engineering and big data technologies.; Proficiency in SQL and experience with PostgreSQL/ ClickHouse.; Comfortable with Unix-like OS.; Familiar with Bash/Shell Scripting.; Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and database design.; Information:; Full Remote, but must be willing to attend on-site coordination meetings if required.; Office location: Mampang Prapatan, Jakarta.

Responsibilities:; Map columns from PostgreSQL to MongoDB schema; Build ETL pipelines using Pentaho Data Integration (PDI); Implement Change Data Capture (CDC) for real-time data updates; Perform data quality checks, especially on fact tables; Manage database integration using Amazon RDS and MongoDB Atlas; Work with teams to support data needs and solve issues; ; Requirements:; Minimum 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer; Good knowledge of PostgreSQL and MongoDB; Experience with Pentaho PDI for ETL processes; Understanding of CDC and real-time data updates; Familiar with Amazon RDS and MongoDB Atlas; Able to write and understand SQL; Placement: Jakarta Barat

Role: Junior Backend Developer / Engineer – Data Platform Focus
job_desc: Junior Backend Developer / Engineer – Data Platform Focus; (Remote, Full-Time, 3-Month Fixed-Term Contract); Are you passionate about data platforms and eager to build your backend development career in a supportive, fast-growing environment? Do you thrive on working with databases, APIs, and backend technologies, especially when it comes to processing, sorting, and organising large data sets?; My Free Course, a rapidly growing EdTech start-up, is looking for a Junior Backend Developer / Engineer with hands-on experience in data platform development to join our remote team. This role is ideal for someone with solid technical foundations who is ready to grow, learn, and make a real impact.; About Us; We are an innovative educational platform committed to making fully funded learning accessible to all.; The Role; In this role, you will focus on building and maintaining the backend systems and data platforms that power our services. You will design and implement solutions that process, organise, and optimise data, making it accessible, reliable, and scalable.; This position requires a team player with strong English communication skills, an eagerness to collaborate, and an organised, detail-oriented mindset.; Key Responsibilities; Develop and maintain data platforms to efficiently process, organise, and manage large datasets.; ; Build backend systems that collect, sort, and serve data to other services and stakeholders.; ; Write clean, well-documented code in Python.; ; Create and maintain APIs for data transfer and integrations (RESTful APIs required).; ; Work with databases such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, and MongoDB to design robust data structures.; Optimise queries and database performance for speed, scalability, and security.; Collaborate closely with other developers, product teams, and designers to align backend development with business goals.; Use Node.js, JavaScript, and TypeScript where required for backend tools or microservices.; Assist with data pipeline creation and automation to handle data ingestion and processing.; Monitor backend systems, troubleshoot issues, and continuously improve reliability.; Required Skills & Experience; 1–2 years of backend development experience, including working with data platforms or large datasets.; ; Strong experience with Python for backend development and data manipulation.; Solid knowledge of database technologies (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB) and query optimisation.; Demonstrated experience building and maintaining APIs (RESTful).; Basic familiarity with Node.js, JavaScript, and TypeScript for backend support tasks.; Understanding of data structures, database indexing, and data processing best practices.; A collaborative mindset (must be a team player) and excellent English communication skills—both written and verbal.; Strong organisational skills and the ability to manage and document complex systems clearly.; Eagerness to learn and grow within a supportive team environment.; ; Desirable (Nice to Have); Familiarity with cloud services (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) for data storage or processing.; Experience with containerisation tools (e.g., Docker) and CI/CD pipelines.; Prior experience working within EdTech, e-learning, or educational platforms.; Exposure to data pipeline tools .; ; Minimum Infrastructure Requirements; Internet speed: Minimum 30 Mbps.; Computer: Minimum Windows 10 with 8 GB RAM or equivalent.; A quiet, secure remote working environment.; ; What We Offer; A competitive salary for a junior-level position.; Full-time, fully remote work with flexibility within core hours.; The chance to work on a high-impact, meaningful project with real-world learners.; A supportive team culture focused on growth, collaboration, and innovation.; 25 days of paid annual leave, plus 1 additional birthday leave (pro-rated to contract length).; Health contribution allowance.; Annual in-person team meet-up (optional for fixed-term contracts).; Three-month fixed-term contract, with clear potential for extension if you demonstrate strong performance and fit well within the team.; Starting Salary: £350–£400 per month (depending on experience and technical proficiency); Schedule:; Monday – Friday; 8:00 am - 4:00 pm UK time (8-hour working shift with a 30-minute break); Education:; Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, ; Software Engineering; or equivalent practical experience; Experience:; 1–2 years in backend development, with proven experience in data platform development and database handling.; Work Location: Remote; Application Deadline: Ongoing; Expected Start Date: To be confirmed; ; ; Are you ready to grow your backend development career by building cutting-edge data platforms in a collaborative, mission-driven team? We would love to hear from you!

About EY:; EY, a global leader operating in more than 150 countries delivers unparalleled service in Consulting and assists clients to transform and upskill their capabilities.; We serve our clients to build a better working world, helping them to create long-term value for people and society and build trust in the capital markets. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities, and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we work towards our ambition to be the best employer.; At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture, and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.; The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.; We look forward you to joining us in the Data & Analytics Consultant team: ; For Managerial level: ; Years of experience: 6-10 solid years of Data engineering and architecture background; Experience:; Design the Logical Data Model based on technical specification requirement; Design ETL logic to transform raw data from source into target table as per the Logical Data Model; Design big data ingestion, loading, and unloading data into a data lake.; Automate data quality error resolution and enforce rules; Prepared test cases and test plan based on the Logical Data Model, Data Mapping and technical specification; Technical skill:; Proficient in data management, database design, ETL design, optimization and development; Proficient in BI development and visualization (optional); Tools:; Packaged ETL tools, i.e. Talend, HIVE and Hadoop, MapR platform; Any database and ETL tools; Cloud architecture; For Senior level:; Years of experience: 3-5 solid years of Data engineering background; Experience:; Translate and develop Physical data model design of transactional and master tables; Data cleansing and data profiling (basic); Develop big data ETL jobs, loading, and unloading data into a data lake.; Implement the delivery of enhancements for an existing Data Warehouse for a new data source system; ETL Unit testing and data validation; Technical skill:; Proficient in data management, database design, ETL design, optimization and development; Proficient in BI development and visualization (optional); Tools:; Packaged ETL tools, i.e. Talend, HIVE and Hadoop, MapR platform; Any database and ETL tools; Cloud architecture; The opportunity:; You will help our clients navigate the business and technology transformation vision. We’ll look to you to provide our clients with a unique business and technology perspective on how technology can transform and improve their entire organization – starting with key business issues they face. This is a high-growth, high-visibility area with plenty of opportunities to enhance your skill set and build your career.; Your key responsibilities:; You’ll spend most of your time working with a wide variety of clients and your colleagues to deliver the latest trends, practices, technologies, and architecture to design, build and maintain scalable and robust solutions that unify, enrich, collaborate and deliver value.; Skills and attributes for success:; Outstanding team player; High level of motivation; Strong work ethic; Self-starting attitude; Independent and able to manage and prioritize workload; Ability to quickly and positively adapt to change; Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, client service, and technical writing skills, coupled with excellent executive presence.; Significant experience in managing and delivering medium to large teams on complex programs and projects.; Assessing, designing, architecting, and developing solutions leveraging the latest technologies and trends to exceed the business requirements; Unifying, enriching, and delivering value to derive insights and opportunities; Leveraging in-house and partners - platforms and solutions as needed and recommending and building new platforms/solutions as required to exceed business requirements; Communicating findings, recommendations, and opportunities to improve platforms and solutions; Demonstrating a deep understanding of technology, concepts, tools, features, functions, and benefits of different approaches; Seeking out information to learn about emerging methodologies and technologies; Clarifying problems by driving to understand the true issue; Looking for opportunities for improving methods and outcomes; Collaborating, influencing, and building consensus through constructive relationships and effective listening; Solving problems by incorporating data into decision making; Proven track record of sales and delivery in a consulting context with established client relationships and experience; Ideally, you must have a:; Bachelor’s Degree or above in Information Systems, Computer Science, Electronics and Communications, or related disciplines.; Minimum three (3) years of experience (for Senior level) and 5 to 7 years for Manager or Senior Manager level.; What we look for; We’re interested in passionate individuals with a strong vision and a desire to stay on top of trends. If you have a genuine passion for helping businesses achieve their full potential, then these role(s) are for you.; What we offer; Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next; Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, on your way; Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching, and confidence to be the leader the world needs; Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs; If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.; EY is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer providing equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, including arrest and conviction records, by applicable law.; EY is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with special needs. If you are a qualified individual with special needs and need assistance applying online or need to request an accommodation during the interview process, please speak to our HR executives, and we will be happy to help you.

On behalf of our client, an IT Consulting company that is looking to hire a Data Engineer position with details below; Responsibilities; Design, develop, and maintain robust ETL processes for data transformation, quality, and reliability.; Build and manage data platforms based on server clusters such as Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka.; Utilize major cloud service providers (AWS, GCP, Azure) for data platform management.; Deliver high-quality, well-tested, reusable, and secure code in compliance; Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and translate them into technical specifications.; Ensure data integrity and availability for various applications and stakeholders.; Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure seamless data flow.; Continuously improve data engineering processes and practices.; Qualifications; Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related major.; Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Data Engineer.; Proficiency in development languages such as Python, SQL, or other relevant languages.; Extensive experience in building and managing ETL processes.; Strong expertise in building data platforms based on server clusters (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).; Familiarity with major cloud service providers (AWS, GCP, Azure).; Ability to deliver high-quality, well-tested, reusable, and secure code.; Strong technical expertise with various data sources and data types.
